intro: Celmisia major var. brevis, commonly known as the short-stemmed celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive foliage. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in native forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
